TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class MobileControl : System.Web.UI.Control, System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor
.class public auto ansi abstract MobileControl extends System.Web.UI.Control implements class System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for all ASP.NET mobile control classes. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As the base class for all ASP.NET mobile controls, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> class primarily contains style and context information common to all controls. For more information about style and context information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> classes.
> [!NOTE] > Because this class derives from the ASP.NET <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> base class, all <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> base class properties, methods, and events are available in each of the mobile controls.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Returns the device-specific adapter for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An adapter specific to the device on which the page will be displayed, which is also usually specific to the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> instance returned is specific to the current <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> object. Any child controls of the current control will use their specific adapter as well.

The index of the control in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddLinkedForms(class System.Collections.IList linkedForms) cil managed

Docs.param: The set of forms that contain links to the specified control.
Docs.summary: Adds the set of forms that contains links to the specified control to the provided list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a form contains navigation elements that activate another form without interaction from the server, it is considered a linked form. There are several criteria for a form to be considered linked. For example, if the following three conditions are met, Form B is considered to be linked to Form A:
- Form A contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link> with its destination as Form B.
- Form A does not contain an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form.OnDeactivate%2A> event handler.
- Form B has no <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form.OnActivate%2A> event handler.
The base implementation does nothing, but other controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link>, override the default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddParsedSubObject(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: An that represents the parsed element.
Docs.summary: Notifies the server control that an element, either XML or HTML, was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Alignment { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An enumerated value specifying the alignment for the style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Alignment%2A> property can be set to any of the following values.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`NotSet`|No alignment is set for the specified object.| |`Alignment.Left`|Aligns to the left.| |`Alignment.Center`|Aligns to the center.| |`Alignment.Right`|Aligns to the right.|

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ApplyStyleSheetSkin(class System.Web.UI.Page page) cil managed

Docs.param: The containing the control.
Docs.summary: Applies the style properties defined in the page style sheet to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> class does not support theming. If an attempt to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.ApplyStyleSheetSkin%2A> method is made, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified background color for the style. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The specified background color for the style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike the other properties, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BackColor%2A> property is not inherited from its parent. For example, if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BackColor%2A> property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit a background color of cyan; you must explicitly set the child control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BackColor%2A> property to cyan, or you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BackColor%2A> property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control. This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool BreakAfter { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. The default is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > Do not set this property to `true` on a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> control. If you set this property to `true`, the control will throw an exception.
This property is ignored by controls for which a trailing break does not make sense. The following table lists the controls that support the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BreakAfter%2A> property for certain kinds of devices. The following table shows the controls with the types of devices that support the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BreakAfter%2A> property. Check with device manufacturers to determine the effects of this property on their devices.
|Control|Device With HTML Browser|Device With WML Browser|Device with WML/UP Browser| |-------------|------------------------------|-----------------------------|---------------------------------| |`AdRotator`|||| |`Calendar`|Yes||| |`Command`|Yes|Yes|| |`Image`|Yes|Yes|Yes| |`Label`|Yes|Yes|Yes| |`Link`|Yes|Yes|| |`List`|||| |`ObjectList`|Yes (unless device's browser can handle tables)||| |`Panel` (default is false)|Yes|Yes|Yes| |`PhoneCall`|Yes|Yes|| |`SelectionList`|Yes (Unless browser can handle tables)|Yes|| |`TextBox`|Yes|Yes|| |`TextView`|Yes|Yes|| |`TextViewElement`|Yes|Yes|| |`Validator`|Yes|Yes|Yes|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreateDefaultTemplatedUI(bool doDataBind) cil managed

Docs.param: Set to if the instantiated templates must bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). Set to if the templates must not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Docs.summary: Called by device adapters to create the default templated user interface (UI) for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Docs.summary: Constructs and returns the style object to be associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The style object to be associated with the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Inheriting classes can override this method to return a more specific style class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreateTemplatedUI(bool doDataBind) cil managed

Docs.param: Returns if the instantiated templates bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). Returns if the templates do not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Docs.summary: Called by base classes to create a templated UI. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.CreateTemplatedUI%2A> method of the corresponding control adapter, which can in turn call back the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.CreateDefaultTemplatedUI%2A> method or create its own device-specific templated UI.

Docs.summary: Returns the set of custom attributes defined for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The set of custom attributes defined for the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.AllowCustomAttributes%2A> to `true` to enable custom attributes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control, or if no such construct exists.

MemberSignature.Value: public override sealed bool EnableTheming { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether themes apply to this control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: in all cases.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> class does not support theming. If an attempt to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.EnableTheming%2A> property is made, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception is thrown.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property is made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EnsureTemplatedUI() cil managed

Docs.summary: Use this method to ensure that the templates are instantiated to allow programmatic access to the instantiated contents of a template. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is overridden by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> classes.
```csharp public override void EnsureTemplatedUI() ```
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.EnsureTemplatedUI%2A> method to access the contents of the `Label1` control within details view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>. This complete example also demonstrates several other features of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> class.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the ASP.NET Web page code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).

Docs.summary: Returns the first page of the form on which this control appears. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The first page of the form on which this control appears.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used for form pagination.

Docs.summary: Gets a object that contains font information about the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The that contains the font information about the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo> class has the following properties.
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Bold%2A>|The font is bold.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Italic%2A>|The font is italic.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Name%2A>|An identifier for this font instance.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Size%2A>|The font size.|

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The specified foreground color for the style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.ForeColor%2A> property to display text in different colors for all the controls and classes listed in the Inheritance section that follows. For example, in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.AdRotator>, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.ForeColor%2A> property changes the color of the text in the control; in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar>, it changes the color of the text in the calendar; and in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ValidationSummary>, it changes the color of the text of the error messages.
The strings that can be used for colors are a set of fixed colors and hexadecimal RGB values. These values can also be specified in the form "#RRGGBB." For example, "#bb7023".
You can also use the Microsoft Windows color constants. For specific details, see <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors>.

Docs.summary: Provides access to the containing form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The form that contains this control.

remarks.format: ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Form%2A> property to determine whether the active form is a particular form in the ASP.NET mobile Web application. This example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.EnsureTemplatedUI%2A> property.

Docs.exception: the control is not in a form as required. The only mobile controls not required to be in a are a and a .

If <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.CustomAttributes%2A> is `null`, then <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.GetAttribute%2A> will also return `null`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Returns `null` if the control is not templated, or if the template does not exist in the selected template set.

Docs.summary: Returns the text inside the control. The inner text might be a combination of text from child controls. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The text inside the control.
Docs.exception: the inner text contains markup tags at run time, and the derived control does not allow markup tags in inner text.
the value used to set this property contains new line characters and the derived control does not allow multiple lines of text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsFormSubmitControl() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if the control submits the form. The default is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the control submits the form; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Mobile controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command>, can override this method to determine whether this is a control used for form submission.
Other controls can be extended by providing logic to programmatically determine whether or not they must be `submit` controls, for example, by checking for specific properties.
> [!NOTE] > A control is considered to be a form-submit control only if it implements <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> method to capture the postback event. Otherwise, it is not registered for the default event handler, even if the method returns `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a object has an active template set. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if the control has an active template set; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To be considered templated, an object must have a [\<DeviceSpecific> element](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5984e67a-91cf-4f32-8815-7e7fab3d3b5b) with a [\<Choice> element](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c81bee77-bb45-4211-be0f-e13a040b3c2d) successfully evaluated for the target device. The selected choice must have templates defined.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnLoad(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method notifies the server control that it should perform actions common to each HTTP request for the page it is associated with, such as setting up a database query. At this stage in the page lifecycle, server controls in the hierarchy are created and initialized, view state is restored, and form controls reflect client-side data.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.IsPostBack%2A> property to determine whether the page is being loaded in response to a client postback, or if it is being loaded and accessed for the first time.

Docs.exception: the control contains custom attributes and the current page does not allow custom attributes on controls.

Docs.summary: Paginates a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When all the contents of a control cannot be displayed on the browsing device's screen at once, this function is called to paginate the control. The index numbers are zero-based.

Docs.summary: Returns the form object referenced by the name parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The form referenced by the name parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you have a link of the format "#form1" in a control contained in a user control, this method looks for a form with `id=form1` in the user control. If not found, it goes up the chain of any nested user controls, and then searches for the form on the page.
> [!NOTE] > Scoping rules walk up, not down, the chain. If you want to browse to a form that is contained in a user control, you must use the ":" syntax used by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method to refer to the form.

Docs.exception: does not refer to an existing .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string ResolveUrl(string relativeUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL to be resolved.
Docs.summary: Converts a URL into one that is usable on the requesting client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The value of the specified URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance object SavePrivateViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves any private view-state changes that have occurred since the page was loaded from persistence. If no changes were made, this method returns . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: An object containing the altered private view state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can override this method to store a private view state. In addition to information saved with the ordinary view state, ASP.NET mobile Web Forms store information such as whether or not the form is paginated. This added information is stored in the private view state and is stored on the client rather than the server. A private view state is saved in an optimized manner. Default behavior, such as making the first form the active form, is never included in the saved private view state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: Returns the server control's current view state. If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns .

Docs.param: A signifying the key of the attribute to be set.
A to be assigned as the value of the attribute.
Docs.summary: Designates an attribute and its value to assign to the object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The attributes set through calls to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SetAttribute%2A> method are stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.CustomAttributes%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override sealed string SkinID { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the ID of the skin to apply to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An empty object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> class does not support theming. If an attempt to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SkinID%2A> property is made, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception is thrown.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property is made.

Docs.summary: Gets the style of the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The style of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string StyleReference { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A reference to the style properties for a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.StyleReference%2A> property must be the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> object. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.StyleReference%2A> property to share styles across controls, either by using inheritance or by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.StyleReference%2A> property of a style sheet. For more information, see the Styles documentation. To find out how to create a new style, see [Creating New Styles](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/da7f9825-3cc7-4c0f-9800-7d3cb15041d1).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets the approximate weight of the control, in characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The approximate weight of the control, in characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used for form pagination. A value of -1 indicates that the default weight for the element must be used. For further information, see [Pagination Support](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/78f2786d-0b5b-4760-9616-5027357713c2).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping Wrapping { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An enumerated value that specifies the wrapping mode for the style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table contains the definitions of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping> enumeration.
|Enumerations|Value|Description| |------------------|-----------|-----------------| |`NotSet`|0|No size is set for the specified object. This is the default value.| |`Wrap`|1|Wrap to the next line.| |`NoWrap`|2|The text is not wrapped to the next line.|
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Wrapping%2A> property by setting the `FirstForm`<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Wrapping%2A> property based on the capabilities of the browser. This code sample is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.EnsureTemplatedUI%2A> property.
